newsitem.title: USA: DC water authority approves move to fee increases.
newsitem.headline: DC water authority approves move to fee increases.

text.p: Members of District of Columbia's Water and Sewer Authority have voted to propose fee increases for a variety of services as the authority prepares to sell debt in the fall, the Washington Post reported Thursday.
The authority will vote on implementing the increases later this year after public comment, the paper reported.

The fees increase is being proposed as the authority seeks as the authority seeks to shore up its finances before going to the bond market in the fall to raise millions of dollars for improvements, the Post reported.

The authority, created last fall, has already voted to end discounted fees for charities and churches, raise rates for all customers by 42 percent, and begin a drive to collect millions of dollars in overdue bills.
